column1: The substantial decrease in the Global Severity Index (GSI) and other specific symptom measures (anxiety sensitivity, fear of bodily sensations), coupled with a significant increase in social support, strongly indicates an improvement in overall psychological health and a reduced likelihood of developing a new disorder, despite a decrease in positive mental health and an increase in dysfunctional attitudes.

Despite a decrease in general psychopathology (GSI), the extreme increase in fear of bodily sensations to clinically significant levels, alongside worsened anxiety sensitivity and key protective factors (positive mental health, social support), indicates the likely development of a specific anxiety-related disorder.
